interpParagraph.content: Construction-permanent loans. Under § 1026.35(b)(2)(ii)(B), § 1026.35 does not apply to a transaction to finance the initial construction of a dwelling. Section 1026.35 may apply, however, to permanent financing that replaces a construction loan, whether the permanent financing is extended by the same or a different creditor. When a construction loan may be permanently financed by the same creditor, § 1026.17(c)(6)(ii) permits the creditor to give either one combined disclosure for both the construction financing and the permanent financing, or a separate set of disclosures for each of the two phases as though they were two separate transactions. See also comment 17(c)(6)-2. Section 1026.17(c)(6)(ii) addresses only how a creditor may elect to disclose a construction-permanent transaction. Which disclosure option a creditor elects under § 1026.17(c)(6)(ii) does not affect the determination of whether the permanent phase of the transaction is subject to § 1026.35. When the creditor discloses the two phases as separate transactions, the annual percentage rate for the permanent phase must be compared to the average prime offer rate for a transaction that is comparable to the permanent financing to determine whether the transaction is a higher-priced mortgage loan under § 1026.35(a). When the creditor discloses the two phases as a single transaction, a single annual percentage rate, reflecting the appropriate charges from both phases, must be calculated for the transaction in accordance with § 1026.22(a)(1) and appendix D to part 1026. This annual percentage rate must be compared to the average prime offer rate for a transaction that is comparable to the permanent financing to determine the transaction is a higher-priced mortgage loan under § 1026.35(a). If the transaction is determined to be a higher-priced mortgage loan, only the permanent phase is subject to the requirement of § 1026.35(b)(1) to establish and maintain an escrow account, and the period for which the escrow account must remain in place under § 1026.35(b)(3) is measured from the time the conversion to the permanent phase financing occurs.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: Under § 1026.35(b)(2)(iv)(B), a county is underserved during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) data for that year, no more than two creditors extend first-lien covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien five or more times in the county. These areas are defined by reference to the specific calendar year's HMDA data. Specifically, a county is “underserved” if, in the applicable calendar year's public HMDA aggregate dataset, no more than two creditors have reported five or more first-lien covered transactions with HMDA geocoding that places the properties in that county. For purposes of this determination, because only covered transactions are counted, all first-lien originations (and only first-lien originations) reported in the HMDA data are counted except those for which the owner-occupancy status is reported as “Not owner-occupied” (HMDA code 2), the property type is reported as “Multifamily” (HMDA code 3), the applicant's or co-applicant's race is reported as “Not applicable” (HMDA code 7), or the applicant's or co-applicant's sex is reported as “Not applicable” (HMDA code 4). The most recent HMDA data are available at http://www.ffiec.gov/hmda.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Minimum durations. Section 1026.35(b)(3) establishes minimum durations for which escrow accounts established pursuant to § 1026.35(b)(1) must be maintained. This requirement does not affect a creditor's right or obligation, pursuant to the terms of the legal obligation or applicable law, to offer or require an escrow account thereafter.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-v-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Forward commitments. A creditor may make a mortgage loan that will be transferred or sold to a purchaser pursuant to an agreement that has been entered into at or before the time the loan is consummated. Such an agreement is sometimes known as a “forward commitment.” Even if a creditor is otherwise eligible for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii), a first-lien higher-priced mortgage loan that will be acquired by a purchaser pursuant to a forward commitment is subject to the requirement to establish an escrow account under § 1026.35(b)(1) unless the purchaser is also eligible for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii) or the transaction is otherwise exempt under § 1026.35(b)(2). The escrow requirement applies to any such transaction, whether the forward commitment provides for the purchase and sale of the specific transaction or for the purchase and sale of mortgage obligations with certain prescribed criteria that the transaction meets. For example, assume a creditor that qualifies for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii) makes a higher-priced mortgage loan that meets the purchase criteria of an investor with which the creditor has an agreement to sell such mortgage obligations after consummation. If the investor is ineligible for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii), an escrow account must be established for the transaction before consummation in accordance with § 1026.35(b)(1) unless the transaction is otherwise exempt (such as a reverse mortgage or home equity line of credit).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a
paragraph.title: Refinancings.
paragraph.content: Refinancings. A refinancing occurs when an existing obligation that was subject to this subpart is satisfied and replaced by a new obligation undertaken by the same <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. A refinancing is a new transaction requiring new disclosures to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. The new finance charge shall include any unearned portion of the old finance charge that is not credited to the existing obligation. The following shall not be treated as a refinancing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-1
paragraph.content: A renewal of a single payment obligation with no change in the original terms.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-2
paragraph.content: A reduction in the annual percentage rate with a corresponding change in the payment schedule.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-3
paragraph.content: An agreement involving a court proceeding.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-4
paragraph.content: A change in the payment schedule or a change in collateral requirements as a result of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or delinquency, unless the rate is increased, or the new amount financed exceeds the unpaid balance plus earned finance charge and premiums for continuation of insurance of the types described in § <ref target="1026-4-d" reftype="internal">1026.4(d)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-5
paragraph.content: The renewal of optional insurance purchased by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and added to an existing transaction, if disclosures relating to the initial purchase were provided as required by this subpart.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b
paragraph.title: Assumptions.
paragraph.content: Assumptions. An assumption occurs when a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> expressly agrees in writing with a subsequent <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to accept that <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> as a primary obligor on an existing <ref target="1026-2-a-24" reftype="term">residential mortgage transaction</ref>. Before the assumption occurs, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make new disclosures to the subsequent <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, based on the remaining obligation. If the finance charge originally imposed on the existing obligation was an add-on or discount finance charge, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> need only disclose:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-1
paragraph.content: The unpaid balance of the obligation assumed.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-2
paragraph.content: The total charges imposed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> in connection with the assumption.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-3
paragraph.content: The information required to be disclosed under § <ref target="1026-18-k" reftype="internal">1026.18(k)</ref>, <ref target="1026-18-l" reftype="internal">(l)</ref>, <ref target="1026-18-m" reftype="internal">(m)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-18-n" reftype="internal">(n)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-4
paragraph.content: The annual percentage rate originally imposed on the obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-5
paragraph.content: The payment schedule under § <ref target="1026-18-g" reftype="internal">1026.18(g)</ref> and the total of payments under § <ref target="1026-18-h" reftype="internal">1026.18(h)</ref> based on the remaining obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c
paragraph.title: Variable-rate adjustments.
paragraph.content: Variable-rate adjustments. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section, an adjustment to the interest rate with or without a corresponding adjustment to the payment in a variable-rate transaction subject to § <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">1026.19(b)</ref> is an event requiring new disclosures to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. At least once each year during which an interest rate adjustment is implemented without an accompanying payment change, and at least 25, but no more than 120, calendar days before a payment at a new level is due, the following disclosures, as applicable, must be delivered or placed in the mail:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1
paragraph.content: The current and prior interest rates.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2
paragraph.content: The index values upon which the current and prior interest rates are based.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3
paragraph.content: The extent to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has foregone any increase in the interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-4
paragraph.content: The contractual effects of the adjustment, including the payment due after the adjustment is made, and a statement of the loan balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-5
paragraph.content: The payment, if different from that referred to in paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c-4" reftype="internal">(c)(4)</ref> of this section, that would be required to fully amortize the loan at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d
paragraph.content: Information provided in accordance with variable-rate subsequent disclosure regulations of other Federal agencies may be substituted for the disclosure required by paragraph <ref target="1026-20-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Termination of underlying debt obligation. Section 1026.35(b)(3)(i) provides that, in general, an escrow account required by § 1026.35(b)(1) may not be cancelled until the underlying debt obligation is terminated or the consumer requests cancellation at least five years after consummation. Methods by which an underlying debt obligation may be terminated include, among other things, repayment, refinancing, rescission, and foreclosure.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Requirements for exemption. Under § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii), except as provided in § 1026.35(b)(2)(v), a creditor need not establish an escrow account for taxes and insurance for a higher-priced mortgage loan, provided the following four conditions are satisfied when the higher-priced mortgage loan is consummated:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, more than 50 percent of the creditor's total first-lien covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), on properties located in counties that are either “rural” or “underserved,” as set forth in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iv). Pursuant to that section, the Bureau determines annually which counties in the United States are rural or underserved and publishes a list of those counties to enable creditors to determine whether they meet this condition for the exemption. Thus, for example, if a creditor originated 90 first-lien covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), during 2013, the creditor meets this condition for an exemption in 2014 if at least 46 of those transactions are secured by first liens on properties that are located in counties that are on the Bureau's lists of rural or underserved counties for 2013.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: The creditor and its affiliates together originated 500 or fewer first-lien covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), during the preceding calendar year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the creditor had total assets that are less than the asset threshold for the relevant calendar year. For calendar year 2013, the asset threshold is $2,000,000,000. Creditors that had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000 on December 31, 2012, satisfy this criterion for purposes of the exemption during 2013. This asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year based on the year-to-year change in the average of the Consumer Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars. The Bureau will publish notice of the asset threshold each year by amending this comment.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iv
interpParagraph.content: The creditor and its affiliates do not maintain an escrow account for any mortgage transaction being serviced by the creditor or its affiliate at the time the transaction is consummated, except as provided in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(D)(1) and (2). Thus, the exemption applies, provided the other conditions of § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii) are satisfied, even if the creditor previously maintained escrow accounts for mortgage loans, provided it no longer maintains any such accounts except as provided in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(D)(1) and (2). Once a creditor or its affiliate begins escrowing for loans currently serviced other than those addressed in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(D)(1) and (2), however, the creditor and its affiliate become ineligible for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii) on higher-priced mortgage loans they make while such escrowing continues. Thus, as long as a creditor (or its affiliate) services and maintains escrow accounts for any mortgage loans, other than as provided in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(D)(1) and (2), the creditor will not be eligible for the exemption for any higher-priced mortgage loan it may make. For purposes of § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii), a creditor or its affiliate “maintains” an escrow account only if it services a mortgage loan for which an escrow account has been established at least through the due date of the second periodic payment under the terms of the legal obligation.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-a-2-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Additional guidance on determination of average prime offer rates. The average prime offer rate has the same meaning in § 1026.35 as in Regulation C, 12 CFR part 1003. See 12 CFR 1003.4(a)(12)(ii). Guidance on the average prime offer rate under § 1026.35(a)(2), such as when a transaction's rate is set and determination of the comparable transaction, is provided in the official commentary under Regulation C, the publication entitled “A Guide to HMDA Reporting: Getting it Right!”, and the relevant “Frequently Asked Questions” on Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) compliance posted on the FFIEC's Web site at http://www.ffiec.gov/hmda.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-a-2-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Bureau table. The Bureau publishes on the Internet, in table form, average prime offer rates for a wide variety of transaction types. The Bureau calculates an annual percentage rate, consistent with Regulation Z (see § 1026.22 and appendix J), for each transaction type for which pricing terms are available from a survey. The Bureau estimates annual percentage rates for other types of transactions for which direct survey data are not available based on the loan pricing terms available in the survey and other information. The Bureau publishes on the Internet the methodology it uses to arrive at these estimates.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for that year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extend covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: A county is “rural” during a calendar year if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area nor in a micropolitan statistical area that is adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget and applied under currently applicable Urban Influence Codes (UICs), established by the United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Department of Agriculture's Economic Research Service (USDA-ERS). A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “rural” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a
paragraph.title: Mortgage transactions subject to RESPA
paragraph.content: Mortgage transactions subject to RESPA —

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-i
paragraph.title: Time of disclosures.
paragraph.content: Time of disclosures. In a mortgage transaction subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.) that is secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, other than a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref> or mortgage transaction subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-5" reftype="internal">(a)(5)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make good faith estimates of the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref> and shall deliver or place them in the mail not later than the third business day after the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-ii
paragraph.title: Imposition of fees.
paragraph.content: Imposition of fees. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-iii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(iii)</ref> of this section, neither a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor any other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may impose a fee on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application for a mortgage transaction subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has received the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section. If the disclosures are mailed to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is considered to have received them three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> after they are mailed.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-1-iii
paragraph.title: Exception to fee restriction.
paragraph.content: Exception to fee restriction. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may impose a fee for obtaining the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> history before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has received the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, provided the fee is bona fide and reasonable in amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2
paragraph.title: Waiting periods for early disclosures and corrected disclosures.
paragraph.content: Waiting periods for early disclosures and corrected disclosures.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall deliver or place in the mail the good faith estimates required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section not later than the seventh <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business day</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the annual percentage rate disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1-i" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(i)</ref> of this section becomes inaccurate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-22" reftype="internal">1026.22</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall provide corrected disclosures with all changed terms. The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must receive the corrected disclosures no later than three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>. If the corrected disclosures are mailed to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or delivered to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> by means other than delivery in <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is deemed to have received the corrected disclosures three <ref target="1026-2-a-6" reftype="term">business days</ref> after they are mailed or delivered.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-3
paragraph.title: Consumer's waiver of waiting period before consummation.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref>'s waiver of waiting period before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> determines that the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is needed to meet a bona fide personal financial emergency, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may modify or waive the seven-business-day waiting period or the three-business-day waiting period required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section, after receiving the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref>. To modify or waive a waiting period, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> shall give the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> a dated written statement that describes the emergency, specifically modifies or waives the waiting period, and bears the signature of all the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> who are primarily liable on the legal obligation. Printed forms for this purpose are prohibited.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-4
paragraph.title: Notice.
paragraph.content: Notice. Disclosures made pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> or paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section shall contain the following statement: “You are not required to complete this agreement merely because you have received these disclosures or signed a loan application.” The disclosure required by this paragraph shall be grouped together with the disclosures required by paragraphs <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> or <ref target="1026-19-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5
paragraph.title: Timeshare plans.
paragraph.content: Timeshare plans. In a mortgage transaction subject to the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.) that is secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s interest in a timeshare plan described in <ref target="USC:11-101" reftype="external">11 U.S.C. 101</ref>(53(D)):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-i
paragraph.content: The requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-19-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> through <ref target="1026-19-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> of this section do not apply;

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall make good faith estimates of the disclosures required by § <ref target="1026-18" reftype="internal">1026.18</ref> before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, or shall deliver or place them in the mail not later than three business days after the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application, whichever is earlier; and

paragraph.label: 1026-19-a-5-iii
paragraph.content: If the annual percentage rate at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> varies from the annual percentage rate disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-19-a-5-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(5)(ii)</ref> of this section by more than 1/8 of 1 percentage point in a regular transaction or more than 1/4 of 1 percentage point in an irregular transaction, as defined in § <ref target="1026-22" reftype="internal">1026.22</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall disclose all the changed terms no later than <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> or settlement.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b
paragraph.title: Certain variable-rate transactions.
paragraph.content: Certain variable-rate transactions. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> of this section, if the annual percentage rate may increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> in a transaction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with a term greater than one year, the following disclosures must be provided at the time an application form is provided or before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> pays a non-refundable fee, whichever is earlier (except that the disclosures may be delivered or placed in the mail not later than three business days following receipt of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application when the application reaches the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> by telephone, or through an intermediary agent or broker):

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-1
paragraph.content: The booklet titled <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Handbook on Adjustable Rate Mortgages, or a suitable substitute.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2
paragraph.content: A loan program disclosure for each variable-rate program in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> expresses an interest. The following disclosures, as applicable, shall be provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-i
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate, payment, or term of the loan can change.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: The index or formula used in making adjustments, and a source of information about the index or formula.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate and payment will be determined, including an explanation of how the index is adjusted, such as by the addition of a margin.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: A statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the current margin value and current interest rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-v
paragraph.content: The fact that the interest rate will be discounted, and a statement that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> should ask about the amount of the interest rate discount.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vi
paragraph.content: The frequency of interest rate and payment changes.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-vii
paragraph.content: Any rules relating to changes in the index, interest rate, payment amount, and outstanding loan balance including, for example, an explanation of interest rate or payment limitations, negative amortization, and interest rate carryover.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii
paragraph.content: At the option of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, either of the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-A
paragraph.content: A historical example, based on a $10,000 loan amount, illustrating how payments and the loan balance would have been affected by interest rate changes implemented according to the terms of the loan program disclosure. The example shall reflect the most recent 15 years of index values. The example shall reflect all significant loan program terms, such as negative amortization, interest rate carryover, interest rate discounts, and interest rate and payment limitations, that would have been affected by the index movement during the period.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-viii-B
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate and payment for a $10,000 loan originated at the initial interest rate (index value plus margin, adjusted by the amount of any discount or premium) in effect as of an identified month and year for the loan program disclosure assuming the maximum periodic increases in rates and payments under the program; and the initial interest rate and payment for that loan and a statement that the periodic payment may increase or decrease substantially depending on changes in the rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may calculate the payments for the loan amount to be borrowed based on either:

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-A
paragraph.content: The most recent payment shown in the historical example in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(A)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-ix-B
paragraph.content: The initial interest rate used to calculate the maximum interest rate and payment in paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b-2-viii-B" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(viii)(B)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-x
paragraph.content: The fact that the loan program contains a demand feature.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xi
paragraph.content: The type of information that will be provided in notices of adjustments and the timing of such notices.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-b-2-xii
paragraph.content: A statement that disclosure forms are available for the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s other variable-rate loan programs.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-c
paragraph.title: Electronic disclosures.
paragraph.content: Electronic disclosures. For an application that is accessed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form, the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref> of this section may be provided to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in electronic form on or with the application.

paragraph.label: 1026-19-d
paragraph.content: Information provided in accordance with variable-rate regulations of other Federal agencies may be substituted for the disclosures required by paragraph <ref target="1026-19-b" reftype="internal">(b)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-v" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, an escrow account need not be established for a transaction if, at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties designated either “rural” or “underserved” by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref>, as set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-v-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Forward commitments. A creditor may make a mortgage loan that will be transferred or sold to a purchaser pursuant to an agreement that has been entered into at or before the time the loan is consummated. Such an agreement is sometimes known as a “forward commitment.” Even if a creditor is otherwise eligible for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii), a first-lien higher-priced mortgage loan that will be acquired by a purchaser pursuant to a forward commitment is subject to the requirement to establish an escrow account under § 1026.35(b)(1) unless the purchaser is also eligible for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii) or the transaction is otherwise exempt under § 1026.35(b)(2). The escrow requirement applies to any such transaction, whether the forward commitment provides for the purchase and sale of the specific transaction or for the purchase and sale of mortgage obligations with certain prescribed criteria that the transaction meets. For example, assume a creditor that qualifies for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii) makes a higher-priced mortgage loan that meets the purchase criteria of an investor with which the creditor has an agreement to sell such mortgage obligations after consummation. If the investor is ineligible for the exemption in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii), an escrow account must be established for the transaction before consummation in accordance with § 1026.35(b)(1) unless the transaction is otherwise exempt (such as a reverse mortgage or home equity line of credit).

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a
paragraph.title: Higher-priced mortgage loans.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1
paragraph.content: “Higher-priced mortgage loan” means a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-35-b-3-v" reftype="internal">it transa</ref>ction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="term">average prime offer rate</ref> for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-i
paragraph.content: By 1.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that does not exceed the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: By 2.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that exceeds the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: By 3.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a subordinate lien.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-2
paragraph.content: “Average prime offer rate” means an annual percentage rate that is derived from average interest rates, points, and other loan pricing terms currently offered to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> by a representative sample of <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> for mortgage transactions that have low-risk pricing characteristics. The <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> publishes average prime offer rates for a broad range of types of transactions in a table updated at least weekly as well as the methodology the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> uses to derive these rates.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b
paragraph.title: Rules for higher-priced mortgage loans.
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts—

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-1
paragraph.title: Repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Requirement to escrow for property taxes and insurance. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(2) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may not extend a <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> secured by a first li<ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">en on a consu</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> unless an escrow account is established before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> for payment of property taxes and premiums for mortgage-related insurance required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, such as insurance against loss of or damage to property, or against liability arising out of the ownership or use of the property, or insurance protecting the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss. For purposes of this paragraph (b), the term “escrow account” has the same meaning as under Regulation X (24 CFR 3500.17(b)), as amended.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(1) of this section:<ref target="1026-32-d-6" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i
paragraph.content: An escrow account need not be established for:<ref target="1026-32-d-7" reftype="internal"></ref><ref target="1026-32-a" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-A
paragraph.content: A transaction secured by shares in a cooperative;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-B
paragraph.content: A transaction to finance the initial construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-C
paragraph.content: A temporary or “bridge” loan with a loan term of twelve months or less, such as a loan to purchase a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within twelve months; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-D
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">reverse mortgage transaction</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-33-c" reftype="internal">1026.33(c)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: Insurance premiums described in paragraph (b)(1) of this section need not be included in escrow accounts for loans secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref> in condominiums, planned unit developments, or other common interest communities in which <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> ownership requires participation in a governing association, where the governing association has an obligation to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> owners to maintain a master policy insuring all <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-v" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, an escrow account need not be established for a transaction if, at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties designated either “rural” or “underserved” by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref>, as set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: A county is “rural” during a calendar year if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area nor in a micropolitan statistical area that is adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget and applied under currently applicable Urban Influence Codes (UICs), established by the United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Department of Agriculture's Economic Research Service (USDA-ERS). A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “rural” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for that year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extend covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-v
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, an escrow account must be established pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> that, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, is subject to a commitment to be acquired by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that does not satisfy the conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, unless otherwise exempted by this paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2" reftype="internal">(b)(2)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3
paragraph.title: Escrows
paragraph.content: Cancellation—

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Failure to escrow for property taxes and insurance.
paragraph.content: General. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(3)(ii) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or s<ref target="1026-35-b-3-ii" reftype="internal">ervicer ma</ref>y cancel an escrow account required in paragraph (b)(1) of this section only upon the earlier of:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Termination of the underlying debt obligation; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Receipt no earlier than five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request to cancel the escrow account.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions for loans secured by shares in a cooperative and for certain condominium units.
paragraph.content: Delayed cancellation. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(3)(i) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or servicer shall not cancel an escrow account pursuant to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request described in paragraph (b)(3)(i)(B) of this section unless the following conditions are satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii-A
paragraph.content: The unpaid principal balance is less than 80 percent of the original value of the property securing the underlying debt obligation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> currently is not delinquent o<ref target="1026-35-b-3-i" reftype="internal">r in defa</ref>ult on the underlying debt obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-c
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-35-d
paragraph.title: Evasion; open-end credit.
paragraph.content: Evasion; <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref>. In connection with <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that does not meet the definition of <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> in § <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="internal">1026.2(a)(20)</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not structure a home-secured loan as an open-end plan to evade the requirements of this section.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Exception for certain accounts. Escrow accounts established for first-lien higher-priced mortgage loans on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013, are not counted for purposes of § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(D). On and after June 1, 2013, creditors, together with their affiliates, that establish new escrow accounts, other than those described in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(D)(2), do not qualify for the exemption provided under § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii). Creditors, together with their affiliates, that continue to maintain escrow accounts established between April 1, 2010, and June 1, 2013, still qualify for the exemption provided under § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii) so long as they do not establish new escrow accounts for transactions consummated on or after June 1, 2013, other than those described in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(D)(2), and they otherwise qualify under § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii).

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-1
paragraph.title: Repayment ability.
paragraph.content: Requirement to escrow for property taxes and insurance. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(2) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may not extend a <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> secured by a first li<ref target="1026-34-a-4" reftype="internal">en on a consu</ref><ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> unless an escrow account is established before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> for payment of property taxes and premiums for mortgage-related insurance required by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, such as insurance against loss of or damage to property, or against liability arising out of the ownership or use of the property, or insurance protecting the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss. For purposes of this paragraph (b), the term “escrow account” has the same meaning as under Regulation X (24 CFR 3500.17(b)), as amended.

paragraph.title: Escrows
paragraph.content: Cancellation—

paragraph.content: General. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(3)(ii) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or s<ref target="1026-35-b-3-ii" reftype="internal">ervicer ma</ref>y cancel an escrow account required in paragraph (b)(1) of this section only upon the earlier of:

paragraph.title: Exemptions for loans secured by shares in a cooperative and for certain condominium units.
paragraph.content: Delayed cancellation. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(3)(i) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or servicer shall not cancel an escrow account pursuant to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request described in paragraph (b)(3)(i)(B) of this section unless the following conditions are satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-ii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> currently is not delinquent o<ref target="1026-35-b-3-i" reftype="internal">r in defa</ref>ult on the underlying debt obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(1) of this section:<ref target="1026-32-d-6" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i
paragraph.content: An escrow account need not be established for:<ref target="1026-32-d-7" reftype="internal"></ref><ref target="1026-32-a" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-A
paragraph.content: A transaction secured by shares in a cooperative;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-B
paragraph.content: A transaction to finance the initial construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-C
paragraph.content: A temporary or “bridge” loan with a loan term of twelve months or less, such as a loan to purchase a new <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> where the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> plans to sell a current <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> within twelve months; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-D
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">reverse mortgage transaction</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-33-c" reftype="internal">1026.33(c)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: Insurance premiums described in paragraph (b)(1) of this section need not be included in escrow accounts for loans secured by <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref> in condominiums, planned unit developments, or other common interest communities in which <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> ownership requires participation in a governing association, where the governing association has an obligation to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> owners to maintain a master policy insuring all <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwellings</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-v" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(v)</ref> of this section, an escrow account need not be established for a transaction if, at the time of <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> extended more than 50 percent of its total covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, on properties that are located in counties designated either “rural” or “underserved” by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref>, as set forth in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iv" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> together originated 500 or fewer covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien; and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> had total assets of less than $2,000,000,000; this asset threshold shall adjust automatically each year, based on the year-to-year change in the average of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers, not seasonally adjusted, for each 12-month period ending in November, with rounding to the nearest million dollars (see comment <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-Interp-1-iii" reftype="internal">35(b)(2)(iii)-1.iii</ref> for the current threshold); and

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D
paragraph.content: Neither the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> nor its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> maintains an escrow account of the type described in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> secured by real property or a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-2" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> currently services, other than:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-1
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established for first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loans</ref> on or after April 1, 2010, and before June 1, 2013; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iii-D-2
paragraph.content: Escrow accounts established after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> as an accommodation to distressed <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> to assist such <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> in avoiding default or foreclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii-A" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)(A)</ref> of this section:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: A county is “rural” during a calendar year if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area nor in a micropolitan statistical area that is adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget and applied under currently applicable Urban Influence Codes (UICs), established by the United <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">States</ref> Department of Agriculture's Economic Research Service (USDA-ERS). A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “rural” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (HMDA) data for that year, no more than two <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> extend covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien five or more times in the county. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-v
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, an escrow account must be established pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-1" reftype="internal">(b)(1)</ref> of this section for any first-lien <ref target="1026-35-a-1" reftype="term">higher-priced mortgage loan</ref> that, at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, is subject to a commitment to be acquired by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that does not satisfy the conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2-iii" reftype="internal">(b)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, unless otherwise exempted by this paragraph <ref target="1026-35-b-2" reftype="internal">(b)(2)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Failure to escrow for property taxes and insurance.
paragraph.content: General. Except as provided in paragraph (b)(3)(ii) of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or s<ref target="1026-35-b-3-ii" reftype="internal">ervicer ma</ref>y cancel an escrow account required in paragraph (b)(1) of this section only upon the earlier of:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Termination of the underlying debt obligation; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Receipt no earlier than five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s request to cancel the escrow account.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-2
paragraph.content: “Average prime offer rate” means an annual percentage rate that is derived from average interest rates, points, and other loan pricing terms currently offered to <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> by a representative sample of <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> for mortgage transactions that have low-risk pricing characteristics. The <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> publishes average prime offer rates for a broad range of types of transactions in a table updated at least weekly as well as the methodology the <ref target="1026-2-a-5" reftype="term">Bureau</ref> uses to derive these rates.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1
paragraph.content: “Higher-priced mortgage loan” means a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-35-b-3-v" reftype="internal">it transa</ref>ction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="term">average prime offer rate</ref> for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-i
paragraph.content: By 1.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that does not exceed the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: By 2.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that exceeds the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: By 3.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a subordinate lien.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: By 2.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that exceeds the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac; or

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a
paragraph.title: General rule
paragraph.content: General rule —

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-1-i
paragraph.title: Consideration of ability to pay.
paragraph.content: Consideration of ability to pay. A <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> must not open a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account for a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> under an open-end (not home-secured) <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> plan, or increase any <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit applicable to such account, unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> considers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to make the required minimum periodic payments under the terms of the account based on the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets and the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current obligations.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-1-ii
paragraph.title: Reasonable policies and procedures.
paragraph.content: Reasonable policies and procedures. <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">Card issuers</ref> must establish and maintain reasonable written policies and procedures to consider the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to make the required minimum payments under the terms of the account based on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets and a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current obligations. Reasonable policies and procedures include treating any income and assets to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has a reasonable expectation of access as the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets, or limiting consideration of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s independent income and assets. Reasonable policies and procedures also include consideration of at least one of the following: The ratio of debt obligations to income; the ratio of debt obligations to assets; or the income the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have after paying debt obligations. It would be unreasonable for a <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> not to review any information about a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets and current obligations, or to issue a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> to a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> who does not have any income or assets.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2
paragraph.title: Minimum periodic payments
paragraph.content: Minimum periodic payments —

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-i
paragraph.title: Reasonable method.
paragraph.content: Reasonable method. For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-51-a-1" reftype="internal">(a)(1)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> must use a reasonable method for estimating the minimum periodic payments the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> would be required to pay under the terms of the account.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii
paragraph.title: Safe harbor.
paragraph.content: Safe harbor. A <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> complies with paragraph <ref target="1026-51-a-2-i" reftype="internal">(a)(2)(i)</ref> of this section if it estimates required minimum periodic payments using the following method:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> assumes utilization, from the first day of the <ref target="1026-2-a-4" reftype="term">billing cycle</ref>, of the full <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> line that the issuer is considering offering to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> uses a minimum payment formula employed by the issuer for the product the issuer is considering offering to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or, in the case of an existing account, the minimum payment formula that currently applies to that account, provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: If the applicable minimum payment formula includes interest charges, the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> estimates those charges using an interest rate that the issuer is considering offering to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> for purchases or, in the case of an existing account, the interest rate that currently applies to purchases; and

paragraph.label: 1026-51-a-2-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: If the applicable minimum payment formula includes mandatory fees, the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> must assume that such fees have been charged to the account.
